info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 3:32PM MDT until September 12 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including Grand Junction, Colorado.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 332 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Downtown Grand Junction. Between 0.4 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Downtown Grand Junction is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Leach Creek, Colorado River, Indian Wash and Gunnison River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Junction, Orchard Mesa, Fruitvale, Clifton and Redlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
